content.text: We published a peer-reviewed paper showing that the forecasting procedures used by the U.N.’s Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change violated 72 of 89 relevant principles (e.g., ‘provide full disclosure of methods’). The IPCC has been unable to explain why it violated such principles. In response, we developed a model that follows the principles. Because the climate is complex and poorly understood, our model predicts that global average temperatures will not change.
content.source: 'Let's Deal in Science and Facts' Wall Street Journal Nov. 19, 2010

content.text: We concluded that there are no scientific forecasts that support long-term global warming, nor any that it would prove dangerous if it occurred, and none showing that cost-effective policies could stop warming. No one has provided evidence to challenge our conclusions. In fact, a leading global warming alarmist has been careful to say that the IPCC does not provide forecasts, only scenarios. In other words, the role of the IPCC is that of a storyteller.
content.source: 'Missing the mark on climate change skepticism: It’s not about the money, it’s about the science' Washington Times, March 24, 2015

content.text: I can very confidently assert, there is NO climate emergency.
content.source: From a talk before then. Slides available.

content.text: During a summit in Chile King Juan Carlos of Spain told the president of Venezuela Hugo Chavez to shut up: ‘Por qué no te callas’ (Why do you not shut up?). Someone must tell Al Gore the same or invite him to visit this corner of the world. It is a never ending winter here in South America.
content.source: Quoting from a climate summit in Chile

content.text: Although I am not a climatologist, it has been interesting to observe climatology from the point of view of an arctic scientist. In order for the field of climatology and IPCC to be healthy, I want to provide a few criticisms, which I hope are constructive.
content.source: Response to Readers: Notes on Climate Change

content.text: … climate change, or temperature, has been rising. Somehow the IPCC decided that the increase in the last 100 years is due to the greenhouse effect; however, a significant part of that would be just due to natural change. So, even if we spend lots of money on suppressing CO2 release, it wouldn’t do any good, because it’s a natural change.
content.source: Executive Intelligence Review, Volume 34, Number 19-20, May 11, 2007.

content.text: We are being fed an enormous load of rubbish... we can see from looking at the past that every time we've had an ice age, we've had more carbon dioxide in the atmosphere than now, so it's clear that carbon dioxide cannot drive global warming.
content.source: Spectator TV

content.text: I don’t like the climate cult. I don’t like the virus hysteria. I can’t understand the gender fluidity push. I don’t like magic pudding economics and I particularly dislike the cultural self-loathing.
content.source: Panel event at the Conservative Political Action Conference (CPAC) in Sydney

content.text: While we still seem to be in the grip of a climate cult, the climate cult is going to produce policy outcomes that will cause people to wake up to themselves.
content.source: On an Israel Public Broadcasting Corporation radio show

content.text: Even if reducing emissions really is necessary to save the planet, our effort, however Herculean, is barely-better-than-futile; because Australia’s total annual emissions are exceeded by just the annual increase in China’s.
content.source: Lecture to Global Warming Policy Foundation

content.text:
This ludicrous myth of man-made global warming is going to impact on agriculture. Farmers apparently are going to have to improve the world weather by emitting fewer greenhouse gases. There are two of them that we emit where we find ourselves in total contradiction to EU dogma.

The first is CO2. We emit CO2 by tractor use, exhausts and engines running. If we are seriously going to reduce that on farms, we’re going to have to reduce our tractor usage and that means we must go to no-till agriculture, which means using glyphosate and adopting GM crops. You hate those two things more than you actually hate CO2.

Then of course we've got the other juxtaposition on nitrous oxide. We produce nitrous oxide by growing leguminous crops. Yet we are told by the EU ‘you must grow more leguminous crops’ because they will substitute for all the GM soya beans coming in from South America.
content.source: 2017 UN Climate Change Conference in Bonn (COP23)

content.text: [A] myth persists that is both unscientific and immoral to perpetuate: that the beneficial gas carbon dioxide ranks among hazardous pollutants. It does not.
content.source: 'The Phony War Against CO2' The Wall Street Journal.

content.text: All this would be humorous if it did not have such serious ramifications. In the vain hope of stopping trivial changes in climate, activists and compliant politicians are working hard to force us to switch from coal and other fossil fuels, America’s least expensive and most abundant power sources, to unreliable and expensive alternatives such as wind and solar power. The public need to ask them, ‘Why are you doing this? Who are you trying to please?
content.source: 'Hypochondriac climate change concerns hurt us all' YourHoustonNews.com

content.text:
Are you aware that if you succeed in decarbonising Europe, our crops will have no natural gas to grow from?

We have to have carbon dioxide. This is madness. Absolute madness what you are suggesting. Our agriculture industry is going to suffer heavily if we attempt to bury carbon dioxide. It is absolutely mad.
content.source: Address to EU Parliament

content.text: We know that carbon dioxide has been a much larger fraction of the earth’s atmosphere than it is today, and the geological record shows that life flourished on land and in the oceans during those times. The incredible list of supposed horrors that increasing carbon dioxide will bring the world is pure belief disguised as science.
content.source: 'In Defense of Carbon Dioxide' The Wall Street Journal

content.text: Climate-change skeptics might be regarded as modern-day witches because they think that global warming comes from natural forces. However, it’s superstitious alarmists, who believe that extreme weather originates in our CO2 emissions and who have a dread of impending disaster, who are really the witches.
content.source: 'Extreme Weather and Superstition', New York Post

content.text: ... no scientifically believable evidence to support the alarmist claims
content.source: 'Climate Change in the Western Cape. Fact or Fiction?', University of Pretoria, Department of Civil Engineering – Water Resource and Flood Studies, June 2010

content.text: I am offended that science is being perverted in the name of global warming — today’s environmental cause celebre.
content.source: 'As IPCC stumbles, sceptics gain ground', Hindustan Times

content.text: The IPCC has actually become a closed circuit; it doesn’t listen to others. It doesn’t have open minds… I am really amazed that the Nobel Peace Prize has been given on scientifically incorrect conclusions by people who are not geologists.
content.source: Quoted in a U.S. Senate Environment and Public Works Committee Minority Staff Report

content.text: We do not deny climate change, but we consider that global warming is not the essential phenomenon. If the temperature increases by 1 or 2° C per century and the sea level rises 25 centimeters, this does not seem catastrophic. We think, for our part, that the essential phenomenon is the increased frequency of extreme events: heat waves or Russian winter, heavy rains with flooding and drought with lack of clean water, and frequent violent tornadoes. All with seemingly random geographic distributions.
content.source: Article in L’Express.

content.text: The science does not suggest dangerous global warming. If there is any trace at all of a greenhouse warming, it is too small to be seen in the climate record. That means that future warming due to human activities will be quite small – well under one degree C.
content.source: 'Human Activity Is Not Cause of Global Warming', media release from the George C. Marshall Institute.
